newsitem.title: SWEDEN: Swedish shipping co in 1.8 bln SKR refinance deal.
newsitem.headline: Swedish shipping co in 1.8 bln SKR refinance deal.

text.p: Swedish shipping company Nordstrom & Thulin said on Friday it was refinancing a large part of its fleet with a 1.8 billion crown agreement with a consortium of four banks.
Nordstrom & Thulin said in statement that the lead manager of the consortium was Swedbank with co-managers Den Norske Bank, Christiania Bank og Kreditkasse and Midland Bank.
The company said it had also signed a new contract for several years for insurance of its ships which would cut insurance costs.
"The refinancing at the same time as a new insurance settlement means that the ship's costs can be lowered by a total of 20 million crowns on an annual basis," the statement said.
